roleset.name: brush a horse
roleset.note: CURRY-V NOTES: Frames file for 'curry' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 41.1.2. (from curry.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: I don't think she'll appreciate that
example.text: John curried his horse with Mary's hairbrush.

roleset.name: curry favor
roleset.note: CURRY-V NOTES: Frames file for 'curry' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 41.1.2. (from curry.02-v predicate notes)

example.name: to curry favor, favor curry
example.text: Overall, the government contends that GE-1's disclosure efforts largely were intended [*-1] to ``curry favor'' with Pentagon officials without [*-2]detailing the extent of the management lapses and allegedly pervasive billing irregularities uncovered [*] by company investigations.
example.arg: without [*-2] detailing the extent of the management lapses and allegedly pervasive billing irregularities uncovered [*]by company investigations

roleset.name: spicy indian food
roleset.note: CURRY-V NOTES: This will occur more often in adjectival usages: (some) curriedweenies. But we might as well put it in place now. (from curry.03-v)

example.name: yummy
example.text: John curried some weenies for dinner.
